intro: Quararibea santaritensis, commonly known as the Santa Rita beauty, is a tropical tree native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by distinctive orange-red fruits. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
